For more information on Anime News Network's internet policies and how information is used elsewhere across Anime News Network please see our Full Privacy Policy at https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/privacy-policy.    By signing up to the Announcements newsletter you are signing up to receive emails containing content published on Anime News Network, as well as additional original Anime News Network content exclusive to the newsletter. The newsletter may also include advertisements or offers of third party services, however your personal information will never be given to these third parties.    The use of information collected on this page is regulated by Anime News Network's privacy policy, and Clarion Event's Privacy policy.    ANNouncements Give-Aways   Anime News Network may occasionally offer give-aways specifically to ANNouncements subscribers. For privacy reasons, we will not auto-opt you in to give-aways. ANNouncements will be promoted in the newsletter, but will require you to opt-in on Anime News Network. The give-aways will only be available to individuals who are subscribed to the newsletter.    Give-Away winners' names and city/state/province will be posted on AnimeNewsNetwork.com, their mailing addresses will be provided to our sponsor and/or shipping agent of choice (ex: USPS), and no one else. Winners' addresses and e-mail addresses will be erased once the prizes have been shipped.    What we don't share   Your privacy is important to us. Under no circumstances will we share any of the personally identifiable information (PII) you have shared with us, such as your name, e-mail address, mailing address or IP address, with any third party, unless your permission is explicitly obtained beforehand, or we are ordered to do so by a court or law enforcement organization (see our  privacy policy).    What we do share   We may, at our discrimination, share tabulated statistical data with our partners. This can include information such the average age and geographic spread of our newsletter subscribers, as well as survey statistics.    Give-Away winners' names and city/state/province will be posted on AnimeNewsNetwork.com, their mailing addresses will be provided to our sponsor and/or shipping agent of choice (ex: USPS), and no one else. Winners' addresses and e-mail addresses will be erased once the prizes have been shipped.    Information submitted on this page   Information submitted on the above form, will be directly submitted to Clarion Events for the sole purpose of managing this newsletter.    Opt-Out   Every ANNouncements Newsletter you receive will include a link to opt-out at the bottom. You may opt-out at anytime. Should you opt-out, your e-mail address and PII will be removed from our newsletter database.           bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    Misc Page homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            news          31 comments       ONIMAI: I'm Now Your Sister! Subscribe to The weekly ANNouncements Newsletter  you can expect to wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week. Think of it like having a friend who reads everything so you don't have to—and then sums up the highlights right in your inbox. Plus, you'll be among the first to hear about new ANN promotions and merchandise as well as occasional special offers and giveaways.    Want a taste before subscribing? Read installment #1 right here.     Terms and Conditions   The below terms and conditions relate to Anime News Network's ANNouncements email newsletter only. For more information on Anime News Network's internet policies and how information is used elsewhere across Anime News Network please see our Full Privacy Policy at https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/privacy-policy.    By signing up to the Announcements newsletter you are signing up to receive emails containing content published on Anime News Network, as well as additional original Anime News Network content exclusive to the newsletter. The newsletter may also include advertisements or offers of third party services, however your personal information will never be given to these third parties.    The use of information collected on this page is regulated by Anime News Network's privacy policy, and Clarion Event's Privacy policy.    ANNouncements Give-Aways   Anime News Network may occasionally offer give-aways specifically to ANNouncements subscribers. For privacy reasons, we will not auto-opt you in to give-aways. ANNouncements will be promoted in the newsletter, but will require you to opt-in on Anime News Network. The give-aways will only be available to individuals who are subscribed to the newsletter.    Give-Away winners' names and city/state/province will be posted on AnimeNewsNetwork.com, their mailing addresses will be provided to our sponsor and/or shipping agent of choice (ex: USPS), and no one else. Winners' addresses and e-mail addresses will be erased once the prizes have been shipped.    What we don't share   Your privacy is important to us. Under no circumstances will we share any of the personally identifiable information (PII) you have shared with us, such as your name, e-mail address, mailing address or IP address, with any third party, unless your permission is explicitly obtained beforehand, or we are ordered to do so by a court or law enforcement organization (see our  privacy policy).    What we do share   We may, at our discrimination, share tabulated statistical data with our partners. This can include information such the average age and geographic spread of our newsletter subscribers, as well as survey statistics.    Give-Away winners' names and city/state/province will be posted on AnimeNewsNetwork.com, their mailing addresses will be provided to our sponsor and/or shipping agent of choice (ex: USPS), and no one else. Winners' addresses and e-mail addresses will be erased once the prizes have been shipped.    Information submitted on this page   Information submitted on the above form, will be directly submitted to Clarion Events for the sole purpose of managing this newsletter.    Opt-Out   Every ANNouncements Newsletter you receive will include a link to opt-out at the bottom. You may opt-out at anytime. Should you opt-out, your e-mail address and PII will be removed from our newsletter database.           bookmark/share with:                         this article has been modified since it was originally posted;      see change history    Misc Page homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            news          31 comments       ONIMAI: I'm Now Your Sister! News Voice Actress, Singer Nana Mizuki Tests Positive for COVID-19   posted on 2022-04-23 13:16 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Mizuki currently has no fever, symptoms are stable    The agency StarCrew announced on Saturday that singer and voice actress Nana Mizuki has tested positive for COVID-19.  The agency said Mizuki is recuperating under the guidance of health care professionals. Mizuki's Twitter account stated she currently does not have a fever and her symptoms are stable.    Mizuki is a prolific singer and voice actress. She made her voice-acting debut in the 1997 romance simulation game NOeL. Her singles, albums, and Blu-ray Discs have topped Oricon's ranking charts. Mizuki's anime roles include Naruto's Hinata Hyūga, Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha's Fate Testarossa, Minami-ke's Tōma Minami, WWW.WAGNARIA!!'s Kisaki Kondō, and Symphogear's Tsubasa Kazanari.   Image via Nana Mizuki's Twitter account   Sources: StarCrew, Nana Mizuki's Twitter account, Oricon        discuss this in the forum (9 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            news          31 comments       ONIMAI: I'm Now Your Sister! News Voice Actress, Singer Nana Mizuki Tests Positive for COVID-19   posted on 2022-04-23 13:16 UTC-8 by Crystalyn Hodgkins         Mizuki currently has no fever, symptoms are stable    The agency StarCrew announced on Saturday that singer and voice actress Nana Mizuki has tested positive for COVID-19.  The agency said Mizuki is recuperating under the guidance of health care professionals. Mizuki's Twitter account stated she currently does not have a fever and her symptoms are stable.    Mizuki is a prolific singer and voice actress. She made her voice-acting debut in the 1997 romance simulation game NOeL. Her singles, albums, and Blu-ray Discs have topped Oricon's ranking charts. Mizuki's anime roles include Naruto's Hinata Hyūga, Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha's Fate Testarossa, Minami-ke's Tōma Minami, WWW.WAGNARIA!!'s Kisaki Kondō, and Symphogear's Tsubasa Kazanari. It IS the plot of the stage show, which was adapted into a hilarious live action movie and the plot described in this article plot IS the plot of the original.   It's like The Hensons taking complete credit for The Muppets Christmas Carol.   No, it's not "inspired" by Summer-Time Machine Blues, it's "based on" Summer-Time Machine Blues. It's a completely derivative work.    Except, in the case of Christmas Carol, we're talking a public domain story and there's no problem with a modern author taking credit for a derivative work.  Ueda better be one hell of a friend to be giving up the lion's share of the credit of his story here. Unless the articles are misconstruing how much credit is being given to the original author- lawsuits could be coming. It IS the plot of the stage show, which was adapted into a hilarious live action movie and the plot described in this article plot IS the plot of the original.   It's like The Hensons taking complete credit for The Muppets Christmas Carol.   No, it's not "inspired" by Summer-Time Machine Blues, it's "based on" Summer-Time Machine Blues. It's a completely derivative work.    Except, in the case of Christmas Carol, we're talking a public domain story and there's no problem with a modern author taking credit for a derivative work.  Ueda better be one hell of a friend to be giving up the lion's share of the credit of his story here. Unless the articles are misconstruing how much credit is being given to the original author- lawsuits could be coming. You are right that it's more than just "inspired" by the stage play though. Having actually read the book I would more so call it an adaptation. It's also not really a sequel to Tatami Galaxy. Back to top                  Spastic Minnow   Bargain Hunter 		    Exempt from Grammar Rules  Joined: 02 May 2006 		    Posts: 4349 		    Location: Gainesville, FL 		        Posted: Thu Apr 21, 2022 3:57 pm            I still don't get how they get away with calling it "inspired" by the stage show. It IS the plot of the stage show, which was adapted into a hilarious live action movie and the plot described in this article plot IS the plot of the original.   It's like The Hensons taking complete credit for The Muppets Christmas Carol.   No, it's not "inspired" by Summer-Time Machine Blues, it's "based on" Summer-Time Machine Blues. It's a completely derivative work.    Except, in the case of Christmas Carol, we're talking a public domain story and there's no problem with a modern author taking credit for a derivative work.  Ueda better be one hell of a friend to be giving up the lion's share of the credit of his story here. Unless the articles are misconstruing how much credit is being given to the original author- lawsuits could be coming. It's a completely derivative work.    Except, in the case of Christmas Carol, we're talking a public domain story and there's no problem with a modern author taking credit for a derivative work.  Ueda better be one hell of a friend to be giving up the lion's share of the credit of his story here. Unless the articles are misconstruing how much credit is being given to the original author- lawsuits could be coming.           Ueda himself is the scriptwirter for this anime, and he also wrote the scripts for both the anime adaptations of Tatami Galaxy and Night is Short. He's obviously not going to sue.   You are right that it's more than just "inspired" by the stage play though. Having actually read the book I would more so call it an adaptation. It's also not really a sequel to Tatami Galaxy.            It does look like the encyclopedia page here lists them as co-creators. The page for the novel has him as "original concept"- so maybe it's just the articles that seem to give a little more out-sized credit to Morimi.
